Description:
"Maison Blanche" One to Admire
Sitting pretty and very authentic in many ways is “Maison Blanche”, a 3 bedroom Californian Bungalow in a prime location off McIvor Road in Kennington.
The moment you step forward through the gates you are greeted with red brick paths, inviting gardens and front timber verandah with traditional solid lacework ornate posts.
Through the double glass doors you enter the open lounge with polished hardwood floors, open fire place and mantle, plus there is a variety of decorative cornices and ceiling domes.
Main bedroom with frosted glass doors, walk-in robe and led light windows.
The other two great sized bedrooms also offer hanging shelves, fixed desks and space.
The eye-catching timber kitchen has the original combustion stove fitted and mod-cons including stainless steel gas hot plates and electric stove, with galley-style fixed bench seating and table.
Ducted heating throughout and 2 split system units for year round comfort.
The multipurpose room incorporates a study, and overlooks the secure yard through double glass doors, with views of the undercover entertaining area.
The 4 piece bathroom has been updated in the past.
Outside finds a double garage, and you can entertain family and friends on the deck.
Huge location with hot spot amenities close by.
Schools, Post Office, Coles, public transport, vets and medical clinics are within walking distance, with Bendigo Central, Lake Weeroona and the new hospital just minutes' drive away.
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321

Description:
AFFORDABLE FIRST HOME / INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITY
Walking distance to cafes and restaurants in the Bendigo CBD, LaTrobe University and public transport; this low maintenance brick veneer unit would suit those looking for an investment, downsizing or those purchasing their first home. The cosy unit comprises 2 bedrooms of which both have built in robes, tiled bathroom with vanity, shower, bath and separate toilet. The large living room has gas heating and the kitchen includes electric cooking, pantry and ample cupboard space. Located off the kitchen is the laundry which leads to the backyard and includes an undercover timber decked patio and a garden shed. There is a single carport to the front of the property to provide off street parking. Enter the property market with this neat and tidy unit while interest rates are low!
Andrew Pearce : 0419 544
251

Description:
Intriguing, Spectacular, Amazing!
From the moment you see this enchanting elevated brick veneer, tiled roof property, you will not want to leave. Set in a quiet court, enter the wide welcoming entrance, off to the right is the large main bedroom with bay window and 2 door built in robes plus large walk in robe,ceiling fan & split system,tiled ensuite with toilet, basin, shower, lots of storage plus great views. 2nd bedroom with built in robes, family bathroom tiled bathroom with shower, bath, basin & tastic. A large laundry with overhead cupboards & separate toilet, linen press. To the left is the kitchen with lots of cupboards, gas upright stove, double bowl sink, breakfast bar and the view. Off the kitchen is the dining area with gas heater, ceiling fan & split system. The large lounge is so inviting, bay window, ceiling fan, charming brick open fire place and once again, the view! Another bedroom sits at the end. Upstairs there are 3 attic windows in the roof and with some imagination could open up this large area. Outside there's a double remote garage with under house access & wood storage box for the lounge. Concreted & powered triple shedding, built in wood burning barbecue & entertaining area & gazebo. The gardens are meticulously manicured & the 180 degree views from the Cathedral around to the old orphanage are amazing. Set on a 1052m2 approx allotment in Kennington, in walking distance to primary school & doctors, close to shopping centres, dining, secondary schools, swimming pool, university & bus stop.
Insights: 5 Fiona Place, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2016 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

PRIME BUILDING ALLOTMENT WITH TOWNHOUSE PLANS & APPROVED PERMITS
Prime 261m2 building allotment right in the heart of Kennington and a short trip into the CBD. Close to primary schools, the University and the newly developed Kennington Village and all that Strathdale has on offer right nearby. Permits and Plans and all services available. Fully fenced. Build with your choice of builders these wonderfully designed townhouses with Cathedral and city skyline views. Harry Trott Reserve as your lush green backdrop. What else would you ask for....

Description:
Individual design in perfect position
Behind the wisteria-draped facade, this architecturally-designed, split-level home was sited on the 524 square metre allotment to make best use of the rear north-facing aspect.
Tucked in between prestigious Mill Street and St Aidans Road, the sweet-yet-sophisticated residence features two good-sized bedrooms, both with robes, spacious open-plan lounge, dining, kitchen and sitting areas. The kitchen is fitted with electric cooking, dishwasher with ample cabinetry and bench space while ducted heating and cooling maintain internal comfort levels.
Every room is graced with large picture windows filtering the light and overlooking the magic garden setting while French doors from the lounge open to a private deck.
An extensive sun-drenched, tiled rear terrace is the ideal spot for alfresco dining with friends or just relax and recline with a book under the wide eaves.
There's a double carport at the front and garden/tool shed hidden away at the end of the garden.
Perfect for downsizers or retirees, the residence exudes good taste and a calm relaxing ambience. It's already a rock-solid investment where excellent tenants hope a keen investor will like it as much as they do so they can stay on.
Quietly located within walking distance to Strath Village shopping centres, Kennington Reservoir, public transport and the university, it's a one-of-a kind property.

Description:
'HIDDEN GEM FIT FOR ROYALTY'
Mawby property has the great pleasure to offer this fantastic home that has been enjoyed and cherished by the current vendor for four generations! Perfectly positioned in a quiet street and sitting on an approx. block of 600 sqm this home comprises 3 bedrooms, large lounge & kitchen, family bathroom, rear laundry with 2nd toilet and ducted heating & cooling. With remote entry single car garage, generous front and rear yards, the possibilities are endless for the first home buyer or investors alike. Even the renovator will reap the benefits with a fully refreshed tiled roof to get things kicked started! Within walking distance to everything central including train station, schools, shopping, & cafes/restaurants this will be sure to grab attention so get in quick to beat the crowd!!
ALL ENQUIRIES MUST INCLUDE A PHONE NUMBER

Description:
When Location Counts
Situated in a beautiful quiet court location in the highly sought after suburb of Kennington. This gorgeous home is ideal for either owner occupier or investor. Comprising 4 bedrooms including a superb double sized master bedroom, and full ensuite, two generous living areas and a classic Tasmanian Oak kitchen.
Outside,
the property is wonderfully landscaped, with easy care gardens and lawns, brilliant under cover entertainment area, a wrap around verandah, and plenty of parking for vehicles and caravans.
Ideally the location is only minutes to the CBD, 100 metres from Kennington Primary and a brief stroll to the Kennington Reservoir, shopping complex and entertainment areas. With so much on offer, inspection is guaranteed to impress so please call now to arrange an inspection.
Jesse Gardner : 0477 277 560

Description:
Great Location + Great House = Great Opportunity
The opportunities are endless here, located in the heart of Kennington sits this spotless 1960's Brick Veneer home offering the best in location and convenience! Set on a 700smq allotment directly across from Strath Village Shopping Centre, in walking distance to the newly completed Kennington Shopping Village and many other specialty stores. The 4 bedrooms are large in proportions all with built in robes and ensuite to the main bedroom. A large and functional kitchen adjoins the formal dining and large lounge room set at the front of the property. Overall this has been a much loved property in exceptional condition.

Description:
Kennington Budget Buy
Not only does this property have the classic three P's of position, position position it has three R's as well. In need of some renovation, reinvention or recycling, the two-bedroom, brick veneer townhouse has undergone some custom alterations and extensions.
Original design consisted of an open-plan kitchen, meals and living area with a bedroom opening off each end a compact combined bathroom/laundry. A rear extension includes a third bedroom, extra living space and an unfinished vestibule/entry.
The kitchen includes gas cooking, provision for dishwasher, gas heating and split system air conditioning flowing throughout the living areas.
Screened from the street by Colorbond fencing and surrounded by minimal landscaping, the block provides for off-street parking with ample room for a future carport or garage if desired.
The prime position needs no explanation. It's an easy walk to the city, Strath Village shops, LaTrobe, uni, schools and much more.
The affordable asking price is practically only land value. Don't procrastinate; this could well be the best-priced townhouse on the market in Kennington.

Description:
Perfectly Positioned Kennington Improver
Perfectly positioned classic post-war 1950's brick veneer with terracotta tiled roof and art deco influences is a prime candidate for a modern makeover. Perfectly sound and comfortable as is but with plenty of potential to be so much more.
The front facade features an interesting feature brick chimney and curved front porch, matching brick front fence and single garage with original timber doors.
Inside, the large main bedroom features a wall of robes, split system air conditioning unit and access to adjoining third bedroom/nursery/study while the second bedroom is adjacent to the remodelled bathroom with large shower recess, vanity and second wc.
Bonus items include ducted heating and cooling, original hardwood floors and decorative ceilings in the main bedroom, spacious lounge and adjoining dining room. Generous kitchen has room for casual meals, electric cooking and split system heating/cooling unit while a rear sunroom includes built-in storage and access to the laundry and back yard.
Walk to everything from here â?? the city, Strath shopping centres, LaTrobe university, schools, medical practice, sports and recreation facilities.

Description:
3 Bedroom Renovated Kennington Home
Set in highly prized Kennington, this beautifully presented, fully renovated home will impress. It comprises of 3 newly carpeted bedrooms all with built in robes.
The lounge contains an open fire place, reverse cycle heating and cooling, ducted gas heating, LED lights and safety switches. Also on offer is a fully revamped kitchen with Caesar stone bench tops, stainless steel appliances and large pantry, and a brand new bathroom with claw foot bath. New floor coverings throughout with vinyl planks through traffic areas. This lovely home has been repainted inside and out including the restored roof.
Lock up yard and easy rear access means this is a complete package, close to Kennington Primary, St Therese's Primary, Strathdale Shopping Complex, and handy to public transport. This is ideal for first home buyers and investors and certainly one that deserves to be on your shopping list.

Description:
TASTEFULLY RENOVATED IN PRIME SPOT!!
Basically rebuilt from the ground up, this delightfully renovated and extended, surprisingly large home, is sure to impress. Period features such as picture rails, decorative high ceilings, lead-light and stained glass have been retained with the addition of an updated kitchen/meals area, added ensuite, European laundry and new fixtures and fittings. The kitchen has a walk-in-pantry, there's built-in-robes in 2 bedrooms and a walk-in-robe in the main. Reverse cycle heating and cooling ensures year-round comfort, whilst outside there's a handy shed and outdoor entertaining area on a low maintenance block. Only about 1.5 kms from the CBD and 2.5 kms from La Trobe Uni, this beautifully presented home will be picked up quickly - so don't delay!

Description:
A CHARMING PLACE TO LIVE!
Surrounded by flourishing gardens, everything necessary has been done here making this much loved one owner house a charming, restful home. Comprising a comfortable sun kissed lounge and dining area extending to a private timber deck offering a lofty treetop perspective of lush lawn and picturesque backyard. The well-equipped timber kitchen complete with splendid view blends seamlessly with the casual family room, creating a centrepiece of warmth and quality for gathering family and friends together. 2 of the 3 bedrooms comprise built-in robes with family bathroom and separate toilet close by, while the master features sunny bay window, walk-in robe, large ensuite with corner bath and separate toilet. Additional benefits include gas heating, split system cooling, plenty of storage scattered throughout plus safe entry inside from the double garage. Amidst the manicured grounds, (641M2 approx.) are 3 rain water tanks, secure fencing and under house storage complete with power and a sink making this the perfect potting shed for anyone with a green thumb. Located close to all amenities, choice of schools and shopping, public transport, LaTrobe University and a quick, easy commute to the heart of the CBDâ?¦It's position is impeccable, neighbouring other quality homes in a peaceful, picture perfect street.

Description:
Secluded Kennington Corner
One of Mill Street's hidden delights, this seventies-style residence is secluded from the outside world by a peaceful garden entry and tree-lined circular driveway where terraced gardens, a cascading water feature and a pretty lily pond add tranquil touches.
Formerly owned by a notable local artist, the home oozes character, warmth and personal style.
It offers three bedrooms, two bathrooms, bright, airy kitchen with new Miele appliances, adjoining meals/family area, formal lounge and dining rooms and a study at the foot of the stairs. Upstairs is an expansive studio featuring front balcony overlooking the garden, two walk-in storage rooms and external entrance from the side street. Possibilities for alternate uses include extra living/rumpus room or new main bedroom while the external access provides options for a home-based workplace.
Private and relaxed outdoor living areas abound under pergolas and established shade trees off the dining room or the enclosed side courtyard where a separate bungalow is perfect for teens, guests or extended family.
Added external features include double carport and garage/workshop, rainwater tanks and sprinkler system. A beautifully crafted, vine-draped stone wall enclosing the property is a work of art itself and adds to the earthiness and serenity of this one-of-kind property.
Insights: 28 Mill Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2016 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Sublime Modern Grandeur
Like a stately manor house, this residence stands tall and proud of its prized position, in close proximity to all family requirements. Cathedral ceilings reveal an upper level gallery walkway and broad landing, with lofty views over Bendigo and garden below presented beyond front and rear balconies.
The heart of the home is occupied by a superb open fireplace, while reverse cycle air-conditioning plus ducted heating and cooling are installed for complete comfort. Wall to wall wool carpets and polished hardwood floors span generous rooms, and quality window furnishings have been custom-fitted.
Multiple zones fulfil numerous purposes, including formal as well as casual living and dining options, along with a substantial children's retreat with abundant in-built storage. A study and up to 5 bedrooms are serviced by 3 bathrooms. Granite benches host stainless steel appliances and a dishwasher in the galley-style kitchen.
French doors galore lead to delightful alfresco areas, private courtyard and immaculate gardens with feature lighting. Extensively paved in slate, the yard is sheltered by a huge shade tree with wrap-around bench and an ornate fountain adds audible ambience. A double garage secures vehicles behind an automatic roller door.
Recently repainted inside and out plus encompassed by low maintenance grounds leaves little to do but revel in sublime grandeur. A short walk to shopping centres, medical facilities, schools, university, gym, bus to CBD and Kennington Reservoir meets all family demands.
Optional bonus: purchase of 3 Sally's Lane at rear boundary would incorporate a beautifully landscaped existing in-ground pool and covered entertaining area to complement this incredible package.
Paul Byrne : 0439 441 198
Insights: 91 Lowndes Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2016 and 5 other 5 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
When Location is Key!
Are you looking to invest or downsize? Well this could be the perfect unit for you! There is a tenant in place on a month to month basis, with no body corporate costs and nothing needing doing this would be a perfect set and forget investment opportunity or great home! A lovely design throughout this 2 bedroom unit is light, bright and in an exceptionally convenient location. The entrance leads you through into the spacious lounge area then on to the well equipped kitchen and meals area. Both bedrooms have built in robes, with a central bathroom, laundry and separate toilet while year-round comfort is assured with central gas ducted heating and split system for both heating and cooling. A single carport secured by a roller door, covered alfresco area and low-maintenance yard complete this great package.
Insights: 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
AFFORDABLE HOME IN SOUGHT AFTER LOCALE
Nestled away in the heart of Kennington, this solid home offers plenty for the family, first home buyer or investor alike.There's room aplenty comprising 4 bedrooms plus a study, a spacious living area, open kitchen/meals plus a recently modernised bathroom. The home also offers evaporative cooling and a gas heater ensuring year round comfort.Outside there is a secure rear yard for the kids to play plus a single garage/workshop with concrete flooring tucked away out the back.Providing a rare opportunity to move into Kennington on a family friendly budget, with the CBD, schools, Strath Hill, Kennington Village, the reservoir and public transport at your doorstep - An inspection is a must!
Please note: ALL ENQUIRIES MUST INCLUDE A PHONE NUMBER
PHOTO ID REQUIRED AT ALL INSPECTIONS
